javadoc:
This class maps a set of address ranges into a contiguous set of indexes from 0 to the
 total size of the address set. This is used primarily by the listing panel to simplify the
 display and scrolling logic.

 Because of the nature of the listing display, not all addresses have displayable content.  For
 example, a closed data structure can consume thousands of addresses where only the first address
 has anything to display while the structure is closed.  This can cause poor scrollbar behavior.
 To fix this, a new method {@link #removeUnviewableAddressRanges(AddressSet)} was added that
 removes those ranges from the index mapping, but the original addresses are also maintained for
 purposes of determining "gap" addresses (an address is a gap address if the original address set
 does not include its immediate predecessor.)  The original addresses are also used so that this
 index mapping can be reset and then given a different set of address ranges to remove as not viewable.
 (Useful for when data is open/closed or created/deleted)

methods.javadoc:
Constructs an AddressIndexMap for the given address set.
@param addrSet the address set to index.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs an AddressIndexMap for the given address set.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the total number of addresses
@return the number of addresses in the view
methods.name: getIndexCount
methods.comment: Returns the total number of addresses

return.comment: the number of addresses in the view

methods.name: isGapIndex
methods.comment:
Returns true if address of the given index is not the successor of the
 previous index's address.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to test for gap in the address set.

return.comment: true if the given index represents the first address after a gap in the address set.

methods.name: isGapAddress
methods.comment: Returns true if the given address is the first address after gap of missing addresses.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address to check for being a gap address

return.comment: true if the given address is the first address after gap of missing addresses.

methods.name: getAddress
methods.comment: Returns the i'th address in the set.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the address to retrieve.

return.comment: the address associated with the given index

methods.name: getIndex
methods.comment: Returns the index for the given address.  If the address is not mapped, null will be returned

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for which to retrieve the index.

return.comment: the index associated with the given address.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the index for the given address.  If the address is not mapped, the result is
 defined as follows:
    if the address is less than the smallest address in the map, then null is returned
    if the address is greater the the largest address in the map, then a value one bigger than
         the index of the largest address in the map.
    if the address is in a "gap", then the index of the next largest address that is in the
    		map is returned.
@param addr the address for which to retrieve the index.
@return the associated index for the given address or if there is none, then the index
         of then next address greater than the given address or null if there is none.
methods.name: getIndexAtOrAfter
methods.comment:
Returns the index for the given address.  If the address is not mapped, the result is
 defined as follows:
    if the address is less than the smallest address in the map, then null is returned
    if the address is greater the the largest address in the map, then a value one bigger than
         the index of the largest address in the map.
    if the address is in a "gap", then the index of the next largest address that is in the
    		map is returned.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for which to retrieve the index.

return.comment:
the associated index for the given address or if there is none, then the index
         of then next address greater than the given address or null if there is none.

methods.name: getAddressSet
methods.comment: Returns the Address set corresponding to the set of indexes

params.name: sel
params.comment: the FieldSelection containing the set of indexes to include.

return.comment: the AddressSet for the given field selection.

methods.name: getFieldSelection
methods.comment:
Returns a FieldSelection containing the set of indexes represented by the
 given address set

params.name: set
params.comment: the set of addresses to convert into a set of indexes.

return.comment: a FieldSelection for the given address set.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the total set of addresses in this map include addresses that have been closed
@return the total set of addresses in the map including addresses that have been closed
methods.name: getOriginalAddressSet
methods.comment: Returns the total set of addresses in this map include addresses that have been closed

return.comment: the total set of addresses in the map including addresses that have been closed

methods.javadoc:
Returns the total set of addresses in this index mapping (not including those that have been closed)
@return the total set of addresses in this index mapping (not including those that have been closed)
methods.name: getIndexedAddressSet
methods.comment: Returns the total set of addresses in this index mapping (not including those that have been closed)

return.comment: the total set of addresses in this index mapping (not including those that have been closed)

methods.name: getMaxIndex
methods.comment: Returns the the maximum address for the range containing the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to find its containing range's max address.

return.comment: the the maximum address for the range containing the given address.

methods.name: getMinIndex
methods.comment: Returns the the minimum address for the range containing the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address to find its containing range's min address.

return.comment: the the minimum address for the range containing the given address.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given addresses from the set of addresses that get mapped into indexes. This is used to remove large number of addresses that are contained in closed data in order to make scrollbars scroll smoothly.

The original address set is maintained to determine the gap addresses and also for resetting the index map to the entire set of addresses @param addressSet the set of addresses to remove from the set of addresses that get mapped.
methods.name: removeUnviewableAddressRanges
methods.comment:
Removes the given addresses from the set of addresses that get mapped into indexes.  This
 is used to remove large number of addresses that are contained in closed data in order to
 make scrollbars scroll smoothly.
 
 The original address set is maintained to determine the gap addresses and also for resetting
 the index map to the entire set of addresses

params.name: addressSet
params.comment: the set of addresses to remove from the set of addresses that get mapped.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the suggested minimum size of address ranges that contain no viewable code units (i.e.
 collapsed data).  Ranges larger that this should be removed from the index mapping to get
 better scrollbar behavior. Currently this is 1% of the total viewed address space.
@return the suggested minimum size for a range of addresses with no viewable content.
methods.name: getMiniumUnviewableGapSize
methods.comment:
Returns the suggested minimum size of address ranges that contain no viewable code units (i.e.
 collapsed data).  Ranges larger that this should be removed from the index mapping to get
 better scrollbar behavior. Currently this is 1% of the total viewed address space.

return.comment: the suggested minimum size for a range of addresses with no viewable content.

methods.javadoc: Resets the mapping to the entire original address set.
methods.name: reset
methods.comment: Resets the mapping to the entire original address set.

methods.name: getAddress
methods.comment: gets the address for the given index given the rangeIndex of the range that contains that index

params.name: rangeIndex
params.comment: the index of the range of indexes that contains the index of interest.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to get an address for

return.comment: the address corresponding to the given index.

name: AddressIndexMap
comment:
This class maps a set of address ranges into a contiguous set of indexes from 0 to the
 total size of the address set. This is used primarily by the listing panel to simplify the
 display and scrolling logic.

 Because of the nature of the listing display, not all addresses have displayable content.  For
 example, a closed data structure can consume thousands of addresses where only the first address
 has anything to display while the structure is closed.  This can cause poor scrollbar behavior.
 To fix this, a new method #removeUnviewableAddressRanges(AddressSet) was added that
 removes those ranges from the index mapping, but the original addresses are also maintained for
 purposes of determining "gap" addresses (an address is a gap address if the original address set
 does not include its immediate predecessor.)  The original addresses are also used so that this
 index mapping can be reset and then given a different set of address ranges to remove as not viewable.
 (Useful for when data is open/closed or created/deleted)
